revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Political post | post = President | body =
the Plurinational State of Bolivia | insignia = Coat of arms of Bolivia.svg | insigniasize = 125px | insigniacaption = Coat of arms of Bolivia | termlength = Five years
renewable once (as of the [[Constitution of Bolivia|Constitution of 2009]]) | appointer = [[Bolivian general election, 2009|Direct Popular Election]] | image = Evo Morales.jpg | imagesize = 155px | incumbent = [[Evo Morales]] | incumbentsince = January 22, 2006 | residence = [[Palacio Quemado]] | formation = August 11, 1825 | inaugural = [[SimÃ³n BolÃ­var]] | website = [http://www.presidencia.gob.bo/ www.presidencia.gob.bo] }} {{Politics of Bolivia}} The '''President of Bolivia''' is [[head of state]] and [[head of government]] of [[Bolivia]]. According to the current [[Constitution of Bolivia|Constitution]], the president is elected by popular vote to a five year term, renewable oncehttps://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/bl.html. If none of the candidates receive half the popular vote, the president is chosen by vote of the [[Senate of Bolivia|Senate]] between the two candidates who received the most votes. The current President of Bolivia is [[Evo Morales]], since 22 January 2006. He was [[Bolivian presidential election, 2005|elected]] in 2005, and [[Bolivian general election, 2009|reelected]] in 2009 under a new Constitution. ==History== During its more than 180 years of independence, Bolivia has been ruled by the military leaders who fought for independence, the leaders of the [[War of the Pacific]], representatives of the aristocracy, and democratically-elected leaders. Also, the history of the presidency has involved civil wars, coups and violence. Different titles have been used, such as "Liberator of Bolivia" (used by SimÃ³n BolÃ­var and Antonio JosÃ© de Sucre), and "Supreme Protector" (by AndrÃ©s de Santa Cruz).
